fields.blog_content: this is an example of a blog

Overview: 

﻿The MS&E Department is scheduled to move into a newly constructed School of Engineering Centre in 2009. The Edinburgh Board of Trustees has set the project in motion while most of the planning is still underway. This is a critical time to design spaces that will serve the needs of the students, staff, and faculty for years to come within tight budget and space constraints. The project team will work with the School of Engineering and the MS&E Department to develop plans that integrate the diverse needs and preferences of the different members of the department community.

Your ideas or Suggestions on:

How we can reach out to members of the community to ensure all demographics are represented
fields.excerpt: Design of ergonomic workspaces and full demographic representation

fields.blog_content:
Overview: 

﻿Leachate from 2 landfills is discharged to the sewage treatment plant adding salt and making it harder to reuse the treated wastewater for landscape irrigation. Improvements to include:

1) salinity goals for the recycled water ( treated effluent ), 2) amounts added by the landfills ( by assembling existing data ), 3) options for reducing salinity contributions from the landfills including rough cost estimates where possible, and 4) recommendations for next steps. The report should be geared for upper management, who must decide whether to proceed with recommendations and spend money.

Your ideas or Suggestions on:

How we can obtain environmentally  approved salinity options for treatment of recycled water

Overview: 

﻿New Tracking System Project Mayflower is a non-profit organisation that teaches youth skills for economic independence. In the fourth year of secondary school, our students (nearly 100% women) write business plans for small businesses that they would like to start when they leave school. If they present a good idea we fund them £1000 to start the business. One pressing problem that we have -- that, hopefully, you can help us solve -- is keeping track of and supporting our grantees' progress. Once a young woman is out of school and her business is underway, it is hard to locate her to check in and see how she is doing. She is no longer in the school and may live a considerable distance from the school, and the information we have gathered thus far is anecdotal and disorganized.

Your ideas or Suggestions on:

Tracking systems that work in remote areas

Overview: 

﻿The condition of the City's streets are deteriorating at a faster rate than they can be repaired given limitations in existing resources. One of the major sources of damage to the streets is heavy truck traffic associated with construction projects in Liverpool Waters. Recently staff presented a recommendation to the City Council to establish a new fee, to be based on a percentage of the cost of construction projects approved in the city. The Council was concerned that such a fee may not truly capture the street repair cost associated with construction or may not fairly allocate these costs to various construction projects. Consequently, the Council requested additional research to identify whether it would be possible to: 1) specifically pinpoint those construction projects and activities that have an actual impact on streets; 2) accurately set fees to cover actual costs; and 3) identify alternatives to fees, such as construction bonds.

Your ideas or Suggestions on:

Different fee structures that could be applied

﻿The MS&E Department is scheduled to move into a newly constructed School of Engineering Centre in 2009. The Edinburgh Board of Trustees has set the project in motion while most of the planning is still underway. Your ideas or Suggestions on:

Space utilisation and ergonomic design of workspaces
